intro: Dyslexia is often defined as an unexpected difficulty in reading, for an individuals chronological age. Some general indications are listed below.
Please answer all the questions. These may be associated with dyslexia if they are unexpected for the individual's age, educational level, or cognitive abilities.
If many of these are observed frequently and the childs score is above 90, we request you to seek inputs from a counsellor
Please read through the unique strengths of children with dyslexia
strengths: Ability to figure things out; gets the gist of things
A good understanding of new concepts
A larger vocabulary than typical for age group
Excellent comprehension of stories read or told to him
Empathetic to the needs or feelings of others

questions.title: Language and pronunciation
questions.question: The childâ€™s  language and pronunciation are  not well developed
questions.name: options_q0

questions.title: Letter names and order
questions.question: The child has difficulty with letter names and order of letters
questions.name: options_q1

questions.title: Phonological awareness
questions.question: The child may not have age-appropriate  phonological awareness
questions.name: options_q2

questions.title: Separation and belnding of sounds
questions.question: The child often has difficulty separating sounds in words and blending sounds to make words
questions.name: options_q3

questions.title: Rhyming words
questions.question: The child finds difficulty with  rhyming words
questions.name: options_q4

questions.title: Speech pattern
questions.question: The child is slow to develop speech and shows immature speech pattern and communication
questions.name: options_q5

questions.title: Multi syllable words
questions.question: The child has difficulty in pronouncing long multi syllabic words
questions.name: options_q6

questions.title: Drawing
questions.question: The child has difficulty with drawing, copying and letter formation
questions.name: options_q7

questions.title: Numbers, colours, shapes, spelling
questions.question: The child faces difficulty in learning, numbers, days of the week, colours, shapes and  how to spell and write his or her name
questions.name: options_q8

questions.title: Narrating stories
questions.question: The child may have difficulty telling and/or retelling a story in the correct sequence
questions.name: options_q9

questions.title: Forgetfulness
questions.question: The child often forgets  rhymes, stories, events, instructions etc.
questions.name: options_q10

questions.title: Using right words
questions.question: The child finds it difficult to recall the right word to describe things
questions.name: options_q11

questions.title: Following rhythm
questions.question: The child cannot clap a rhythm or keep a musical beat
questions.name: options_q12

questions.title: Easily distracted
questions.question: The child gets easily distracted
questions.name: options_q13

questions.title: Spatial concepts
questions.question: The child has difficulty understanding spatial concepts
questions.name: options_q14

questions.title: Buttoning and tying shoe laces
questions.question: The child may face difficulty in getting dressed, in buttoning and in tying shoe laces
questions.name: options_q15

questions.title: Dominant hand
questions.question: The child has not established a dominant hand
questions.name: options_q16

questions.title: Balance and co-ordination
questions.question: The child has poor balance and co-ordination
questions.name: options_q17

questions.title: Concept of time
questions.question: The child does not have a well-developed concept of time
questions.name: options_q18

questions.title: Social Skills
questions.question: The child has limited social skills
questions.name: options_q19

questions.title: Multi-step instructions
questions.question: The child has difficulty in following multi step instructions
questions.name: options_q20
